summary: This is a letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the scheduling of her arraignment, initial appearance, and bail hearing. The letter confirms Maxwell's waiver of physical presence and proposes a remote proceeding on July 14, 2020.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of the law firm Cohen & Gresser LLP, who is the subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. She is detained at the Metropolitan Detention Center and has agreed to waive her physical presence for court proceedings.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell in the Southern District of New York. The letter is addressed to her in response to a scheduling order.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: An attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell. He is a signatory on the letter submitted to the court.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: An attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell. His name is listed as a signatory alongside Mark S. Cohen on the letter.

connections.description: Mark S. Cohen is an attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP who is representing Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case.
Christian R. Everdell is an attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP who is representing Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case.
Judge Alison J. Nathan is presiding over the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Defense Letter to Court on Scheduling
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys submit a letter to Judge Nathan regarding the scheduling of her arraignment, initial appearance, and bail hearing, confirming her waiver of physical presence.

events.title: Proposed Remote Court Proceedings
events.description: The defense and government agree to proceed remotely for Maxwell's arraignment, initial appearance, and bail hearing on this date.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is detained at the Metropolitan Detention Center.
Maxwell has agreed to waive her physical presence for her arraignment, initial appearance, and bail hearing.
All parties agreed to proceed remotely on the morning of July 14, 2020.
The defense attorneys were able to speak to Maxwell for the first time on the evening of July 6, 2020, just before 9:00pm.
